I wasn't sure if they were implying like "here" as in place, space, or time, but I just said "yes" and moved on.  I had a feeling I was not the preferred demographic of the Roosevelt Room.I found my friend (who was from San Antonio) and apologized for being late because a 10 minute drive was 30 minutes and Austin is horrible.  She apologized because she said that she  realized that the Roosevelt Room waitstaff was very important and probably wouldn't be very attentive.  I told her that I was used to that because this is Austin and when you go out in Austin it is really like you are working for the waitstaff not like they are serving you.  I think it is part of the "experience".The Roosevelt Room is very dark and has an atmosphere going on.  It's great.  But if you are of the demographic that might need readers - you probably won't be able to see the menu.  So just ask the waiter (when they have time to show up) what drink they recommend and then they will help you out.  The drinks are really good and quite pretty.  And expensive.  Overall we had a good time at the Roosevelt Room.  Once our waiter realized we were spending a lot (expense account) he had more time for us.  Doubtful I will return.  We did eat some cheese board type food.  It was somewhat unremarkable.  We had to wait a while for everything (they kitchen was backed up... it was cheese!) They have giant ice cubes if you are into that.

On my honeymoon went in and ordered a $7 drink and was charged $11 for it. Didn't want to be that guy and argue over it. The people sitting in front of us (two couples) pointed at us and talk about us and laughed the whole time. The music is so loud it's almost impossible to order. I just had to point at what I wanted. I usually trust yelp reviews but not after this one.

Been ending our nights here most nights for the past few nights. The cocktails are on point with this one. I wouldn't recommend coming here for food. If you want finger food because you missed out with your friends or are feeling a snack but not for full on dinner. This is a good place to network and connect with business partners and colleagues as well as bring a hot date to at the same time. Every penny is well worth it. There was some lady who worked there who didn't match the place but all the staff were friendly and patient as colleagues talked their heads off. This will be my go to place for drinks and connecting in Austin. See you tonight and Salute!
What an experience!!! Hands down...the best intimate specialty coctail bar/lounge I've ever been. I wish there was one in Houston!
Great mixology and choice of classic drinks. Good for a business meeting without the food but they open at 4:00 pm

Would have given this place one star if our waitress Hirrah sucked, but she was hands down the best part of this "bar."Have you ever been to a BAR where you are asked to be quiet? I sure haven't until Joy, who is apparently the manager of the restaurant did. Mind you, the restaurant was loud and packed full of people and by no means were we being louder than our usual. We actually hit up 5 other bars the same night and never was once asked to be quiet. Joy actually humiliated our server and was extremely unprofessional. Joy came up to us while our server was at our table and asked us to be quiet. She then proceeded to discipline our server in front of us, making it uncomfortable for her and us. Joy basically was pissed because Hirrah our server didn't tell us to be quiet and she had to do it...one we weren't loud until she said something and continued to walk by our table and glare at us. She walked by 4 times within a 15 minute timeframe glaring. What kind of manager does that? If I were the owner I would re-evaluate who is managing the place cause you're gonna lose good people like Hirrah. Other than that, the food was delicious, drinks were also great. Being a visitor of Austin, I probably would not suggest coming here because of Joy. Her unprofessionalism was uncalled for.

Great speak-easy and bar menu. It's a unique signature place to have some incredible cocktails. They know how to make it right: from all era's of time, they mix their cocktails to suit your style.I couldn't find a bad thing about these drinks. The decor is beautiful, and the staff is absolute top notch. They consistently checked in with me. Gave me some vast knowledge of the restaurant/bar. There are more than 50 mixed cocktails, and over 20 unique signature concoctions that the owner came out with. So much more to write about this restaurant and the menu, but it's something you need to come and see for yourself. Come thirsty and hungry, because it's definitely worth the visit!

This place is awesome! I highly recommend the Roosevelt Room. It had a great vibe with really cool paintings on exposed brick. Sharon was so amazing. Every cocktail that she made looked amazing and tasted even better. She also had a great vibe about her and she was very enthusiastic and passionate about her craft.  You will love this place!

Had cocktails at The Roosevelt Room on Monday night. Wonderful environment to enjoy some well crafted and delicious drinks.Quality: The Roosevelt Room is the spot for cocktails in Austin. With a menu listing nearly 75 options, some house creations, others classic cocktails, there is something for everyone. And if you still can't find anything, the bartenders will put something together for you. Do not hesitate to take advantage of their knowledge, as they can provide guidance to get you exactly what you are looking for. On this evening I tried a Butterbean, a Black Mountain Coffee, and a Coconut Daiquiri. All three were solid drinks, expertly crafted, and beautifully presented.Quantity: Depends on the drink, some are just a few sips, others a solid pour.Value: The majority of cocktails ranged from $13 to $20.Ambiance: The Roosevelt Room is located in Downtown Austin. With a bit of separation from the rest of the Austin bar scene, The Roosevelt Room is a more elegant and stylish spot. As you push past the curtains you enter a dimly lit lounge. Black couches populate the right side and a long bar occupies the left. Black and white paintings decorate the walls, and a screen hung down showing episodes of Twin Peaks. Jazz and traditional pop filled the air, and we were informed live jazz takes over on Thursday. It is an intimate setting, one you almost feel like you should be dressed up to visit.Crowd: Even on a Monday night, nearly every seat in the house was full. Expect to see lots of couples on dates.Service: Bartenders that don't mess around when it comes to quality drinks.Parking: Limited street parking and nearby parking garages.

Went to the Roosevelt Room on Friday night around 6:30 for happy. We didn't have a reservation and didn't have to wait to sit at the long table/bar. The vibe/ inside decor is so so cool. There are pictures of Teddy and Eleanor on the walls and old books everywhere which is super fun. The menu is a little overwhelming at first but the waiters are super helpful and walk you through everything. We tried 1 alcoholic and 1 non-alcoholic and they were both amazing! Super nice spot the chill before going out or going to dinner.

Simply put - this place it awesome. Old-time speakeasy with a deep, expansive menu. If you can't find a drink here then maybe you're doing it wrong. The menus deep, varied, and delicious. There's something for everyone here. Within each drink category it starts mellow and gets progressively boozy. For me the Volstead (1933-1950's) was the sweet spot. The Millionaire was incredible! Went back for the Tiki (1950-1970's) Jungle Bird, you've never had anything like this. Modern Classics (2000s - present) Naked and Famous should be famous. And the Oaxaca Old Fashion is a mole twist on the tried and true old fashioned. Make plans, make a reservation and go. It's worth. Did I mention they play classic movies too! Yes please.

This is the best bar in Austin, hands down. Drinks are pricey but amazing and parking can be a bit tough but it's downtown Austin so you can't expect anything less. Great happy hour, awesome drinks an bartenders, just awesome.
Great vibe and amazing drinks! $7 cocktails at happy hour (and all day Mon/Tues) brings luxury without crazy prices.
The drinks are way overpriced, the staff was slow and inattentive, and the food (if you can call it that) was a joke. Paaaaaasss

Well, I love cocktails and this place is now one of my favorite cocktail bars. Anywhere. The atmosphere sets the tone for this place. You either need a reservation or patience to get in. We had the latter. Once in it like a old speakeasy. With a cocktail menu that is ordered by eras and each era ordered by strength. If you can, sit at the bar or in view. The best show in the house is watching a bartender craft these special drinks. It really is awe inspiring. But don't be in a hurry. These take some time and the place is packed. Be patient and order the next round a little early.

I stopped by The Roosevelt Room rather quickly and on a whim a couple nights back. From getting in, to being seated at the bar, the entire experience was wonderful. The atmosphere was speakeasy chic, but casual and the bartenders were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The selections were expansive. They had a board of cocktails that walk you through eras and have so many things that you've never had. I asked Eric (on of the folks on staff)  to make something he thought was great and he asked some insightful questions and delivered a VERY good cocktail. I'd say it's a good place for a date and a good places to be with good friends, especially if you are tired of other Austin watering holes. The atmosphere, service, and goods are....well good. I'll be back every time in in town and their open.

This place used to be my favorite bar/lounge in Austin. Until they changed it to no-walk ins (even though there are tons of seats available, it's just an attempt to crest exclusivity). Once that happened I've never been able to get a seat and I've crossed it off my list permanently.

Really solid bar. Dark and makes for a simple and old school atmosphere. Cocktail game hits all the good stuff and some house concoctions. Happy Hour until 7pm for $7 specials and half off bubbles on Sundays. Can get expensive if you want to go with big liquors but a classic cocktail is about $14 which is reasonable considering these bartenders are top of the line and know their stuff. Had an old fashioned and really just a very good rendition  easy to just sit here and sip for a few hours with not too much hassle. Can get loud and have one projector, but if you go earlier in day the bar will be all yours. I will be back late night and test out some of the classics for sure.

If you have a work function and you want to use this for happy hour, DON'T BOTHER. We had a reservation for 6 people that started around happy hour time. We arrived at about 5pm and we were told to leave our table at 7pm so that another party with a reservation could take it - we had finished drinks and were about to order dinner. So, basically, this places treats you like riffraff if you make a reservation for happy hour. Absolutely unacceptable and I am beyond angry.
Best place to have any type of drink. Great service and awesome staff. We usually take our friends and family to try it out. This place is awesome.

This place used to be my favorite bar/lounge in Austin. Until they changed it to no-walk ins (even though there are tons of seats available, it's just an attempt to crest exclusivity). Once that happened I've never been able to get a seat and I've crossed it off my list permanently.

Really solid bar. Dark and makes for a simple and old school atmosphere. Cocktail game hits all the good stuff and some house concoctions. Happy Hour until 7pm for $7 specials and half off bubbles on Sundays. Can get expensive if you want to go with big liquors but a classic cocktail is about $14 which is reasonable considering these bartenders are top of the line and know their stuff. Had an old fashioned and really just a very good rendition  easy to just sit here and sip for a few hours with not too much hassle. Can get loud and have one projector, but if you go earlier in day the bar will be all yours. I will be back late night and test out some of the classics for sure.

If you have a work function and you want to use this for happy hour, DON'T BOTHER. We had a reservation for 6 people that started around happy hour time. We arrived at about 5pm and we were told to leave our table at 7pm so that another party with a reservation could take it - we had finished drinks and were about to order dinner. So, basically, this places treats you like riffraff if you make a reservation for happy hour. Absolutely unacceptable and I am beyond angry.
Best place to have any type of drink. Great service and awesome staff. We usually take our friends and family to try it out. This place is awesome.

I went to the Roosevelt Room to meet a business colleague for a drink/happy hour.  So after I braved 5 o'clock traffic (yes it took me 30 minutes to go 1 mile!) I arrived for my first visit at the Roosevelt Room.I opened the heavy door to a dark area a small creature (I'm guessing some sort of host) who just looked at me.  I explained I was there to meet someone (I knew my colleague was already there so I walked past them and the heavy curtain) and the small creature said "do you know they are HERE?" I wasn't sure if they were implying like "here" as in place, space, or time, but I just said "yes" and moved on.  I had a feeling I was not the preferred demographic of the Roosevelt Room.I found my friend (who was from San Antonio) and apologized for being late because a 10 minute drive was 30 minutes and Austin is horrible.  She apologized because she said that she  realized that the Roosevelt Room waitstaff was very important and probably wouldn't be very attentive.  I told her that I was used to that because this is Austin and when you go out in Austin it is really like you are working for the waitstaff not like they are serving you.  I think it is part of the "experience".The Roosevelt Room is very dark and has an atmosphere going on.  It's great.  But if you are of the demographic that might need readers - you probably won't be able to see the menu.  So just ask the waiter (when they have time to show up) what drink they recommend and then they will help you out.  The drinks are really good and quite pretty.  And expensive.  Overall we had a good time at the Roosevelt Room.  Once our waiter realized we were spending a lot (expense account) he had more time for us.  Doubtful I will return.  We did eat some cheese board type food.  It was somewhat unremarkable.  We had to wait a while for everything (they kitchen was backed up... it was cheese!) They have giant ice cubes if you are into that.

On my honeymoon went in and ordered a $7 drink and was charged $11 for it. Didn't want to be that guy and argue over it. The people sitting in front of us (two couples) pointed at us and talk about us and laughed the whole time. The music is so loud it's almost impossible to order. I just had to point at what I wanted. I usually trust yelp reviews but not after this one.

Been ending our nights here most nights for the past few nights. The cocktails are on point with this one. I wouldn't recommend coming here for food. If you want finger food because you missed out with your friends or are feeling a snack but not for full on dinner. This is a good place to network and connect with business partners and colleagues as well as bring a hot date to at the same time. Every penny is well worth it. There was some lady who worked there who didn't match the place but all the staff were friendly and patient as colleagues talked their heads off. This will be my go to place for drinks and connecting in Austin. See you tonight and Salute!
What an experience!!! Hands down...the best intimate specialty coctail bar/lounge I've ever been. I wish there was one in Houston!
Great mixology and choice of classic drinks. Good for a business meeting without the food but they open at 4:00 pm

Would have given this place one star if our waitress Hirrah sucked, but she was hands down the best part of this "bar."Have you ever been to a BAR where you are asked to be quiet? I sure haven't until Joy, who is apparently the manager of the restaurant did. Mind you, the restaurant was loud and packed full of people and by no means were we being louder than our usual. We actually hit up 5 other bars the same night and never was once asked to be quiet. Joy actually humiliated our server and was extremely unprofessional. Joy came up to us while our server was at our table and asked us to be quiet. She then proceeded to discipline our server in front of us, making it uncomfortable for her and us. Joy basically was pissed because Hirrah our server didn't tell us to be quiet and she had to do it...one we weren't loud until she said something and continued to walk by our table and glare at us. She walked by 4 times within a 15 minute timeframe glaring. What kind of manager does that? If I were the owner I would re-evaluate who is managing the place cause you're gonna lose good people like Hirrah. Other than that, the food was delicious, drinks were also great. Being a visitor of Austin, I probably would not suggest coming here because of Joy. Her unprofessionalism was uncalled for.

Great speak-easy and bar menu. It's a unique signature place to have some incredible cocktails. They know how to make it right: from all era's of time, they mix their cocktails to suit your style.I couldn't find a bad thing about these drinks. The decor is beautiful, and the staff is absolute top notch. They consistently checked in with me. Gave me some vast knowledge of the restaurant/bar. There are more than 50 mixed cocktails, and over 20 unique signature concoctions that the owner came out with. So much more to write about this restaurant and the menu, but it's something you need to come and see for yourself. Come thirsty and hungry, because it's definitely worth the visit!

This place is awesome! I highly recommend the Roosevelt Room. It had a great vibe with really cool paintings on exposed brick. Sharon was so amazing. Every cocktail that she made looked amazing and tasted even better. She also had a great vibe about her and she was very enthusiastic and passionate about her craft.  You will love this place!

Had cocktails at The Roosevelt Room on Monday night. Wonderful environment to enjoy some well crafted and delicious drinks.Quality: The Roosevelt Room is the spot for cocktails in Austin. With a menu listing nearly 75 options, some house creations, others classic cocktails, there is something for everyone. And if you still can't find anything, the bartenders will put something together for you. Do not hesitate to take advantage of their knowledge, as they can provide guidance to get you exactly what you are looking for. On this evening I tried a Butterbean, a Black Mountain Coffee, and a Coconut Daiquiri. All three were solid drinks, expertly crafted, and beautifully presented.Quantity: Depends on the drink, some are just a few sips, others a solid pour.Value: The majority of cocktails ranged from $13 to $20.Ambiance: The Roosevelt Room is located in Downtown Austin. With a bit of separation from the rest of the Austin bar scene, The Roosevelt Room is a more elegant and stylish spot. As you push past the curtains you enter a dimly lit lounge. Black couches populate the right side and a long bar occupies the left. Black and white paintings decorate the walls, and a screen hung down showing episodes of Twin Peaks. Jazz and traditional pop filled the air, and we were informed live jazz takes over on Thursday. It is an intimate setting, one you almost feel like you should be dressed up to visit.Crowd: Even on a Monday night, nearly every seat in the house was full. Expect to see lots of couples on dates.Service: Bartenders that don't mess around when it comes to quality drinks.Parking: Limited street parking and nearby parking garages.

Went to the Roosevelt Room on Friday night around 6:30 for happy. We didn't have a reservation and didn't have to wait to sit at the long table/bar. The vibe/ inside decor is so so cool. There are pictures of Teddy and Eleanor on the walls and old books everywhere which is super fun. The menu is a little overwhelming at first but the waiters are super helpful and walk you through everything. We tried 1 alcoholic and 1 non-alcoholic and they were both amazing! Super nice spot the chill before going out or going to dinner.

Simply put - this place it awesome. Old-time speakeasy with a deep, expansive menu. If you can't find a drink here then maybe you're doing it wrong. The menus deep, varied, and delicious. There's something for everyone here. Within each drink category it starts mellow and gets progressively boozy. For me the Volstead (1933-1950's) was the sweet spot. The Millionaire was incredible! Went back for the Tiki (1950-1970's) Jungle Bird, you've never had anything like this. Modern Classics (2000s - present) Naked and Famous should be famous. And the Oaxaca Old Fashion is a mole twist on the tried and true old fashioned. Make plans, make a reservation and go. It's worth. Did I mention they play classic movies too! Yes please.

This is the best bar in Austin, hands down. Drinks are pricey but amazing and parking can be a bit tough but it's downtown Austin so you can't expect anything less. Great happy hour, awesome drinks an bartenders, just awesome.
Great vibe and amazing drinks! $7 cocktails at happy hour (and all day Mon/Tues) brings luxury without crazy prices.
The drinks are way overpriced, the staff was slow and inattentive, and the food (if you can call it that) was a joke. Paaaaaasss

Well, I love cocktails and this place is now one of my favorite cocktail bars. Anywhere. The atmosphere sets the tone for this place. You either need a reservation or patience to get in. We had the latter. Once in it like a old speakeasy. With a cocktail menu that is ordered by eras and each era ordered by strength. If you can, sit at the bar or in view. The best show in the house is watching a bartender craft these special drinks. It really is awe inspiring. But don't be in a hurry. These take some time and the place is packed. Be patient and order the next round a little early.

I stopped by The Roosevelt Room rather quickly and on a whim a couple nights back. From getting in, to being seated at the bar, the entire experience was wonderful. The atmosphere was speakeasy chic, but casual and the bartenders were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The selections were expansive. They had a board of cocktails that walk you through eras and have so many things that you've never had. I asked Eric (on of the folks on staff)  to make something he thought was great and he asked some insightful questions and delivered a VERY good cocktail. I'd say it's a good place for a date and a good places to be with good friends, especially if you are tired of other Austin watering holes. The atmosphere, service, and goods are....well good. I'll be back every time in in town and their open.

Great vibe and amazing drinks! $7 cocktails at happy hour (and all day Mon/Tues) brings luxury without crazy prices.
The drinks are way overpriced, the staff was slow and inattentive, and the food (if you can call it that) was a joke. Paaaaaasss

Well, I love cocktails and this place is now one of my favorite cocktail bars. Anywhere. The atmosphere sets the tone for this place. You either need a reservation or patience to get in. We had the latter. Once in it like a old speakeasy. With a cocktail menu that is ordered by eras and each era ordered by strength. If you can, sit at the bar or in view. The best show in the house is watching a bartender craft these special drinks. It really is awe inspiring. But don't be in a hurry. These take some time and the place is packed. Be patient and order the next round a little early.

I stopped by The Roosevelt Room rather quickly and on a whim a couple nights back. From getting in, to being seated at the bar, the entire experience was wonderful. The atmosphere was speakeasy chic, but casual and the bartenders were incredibly friendly and knowledgeable. The selections were expansive. They had a board of cocktails that walk you through eras and have so many things that you've never had. I asked Eric (on of the folks on staff)  to make something he thought was great and he asked some insightful questions and delivered a VERY good cocktail. I'd say it's a good place for a date and a good places to be with good friends, especially if you are tired of other Austin watering holes. The atmosphere, service, and goods are....well good. I'll be back every time in in town and their open.

This place used to be my favorite bar/lounge in Austin. Until they changed it to no-walk ins (even though there are tons of seats available, it's just an attempt to crest exclusivity). Once that happened I've never been able to get a seat and I've crossed it off my list permanently.

Really solid bar. Dark and makes for a simple and old school atmosphere. Cocktail game hits all the good stuff and some house concoctions. Happy Hour until 7pm for $7 specials and half off bubbles on Sundays. Can get expensive if you want to go with big liquors but a classic cocktail is about $14 which is reasonable considering these bartenders are top of the line and know their stuff. Had an old fashioned and really just a very good rendition  easy to just sit here and sip for a few hours with not too much hassle. Can get loud and have one projector, but if you go earlier in day the bar will be all yours. I will be back late night and test out some of the classics for sure.

If you have a work function and you want to use this for happy hour, DON'T BOTHER. We had a reservation for 6 people that started around happy hour time. We arrived at about 5pm and we were told to leave our table at 7pm so that another party with a reservation could take it - we had finished drinks and were about to order dinner. So, basically, this places treats you like riffraff if you make a reservation for happy hour. Absolutely unacceptable and I am beyond angry.
Best place to have any type of drink. Great service and awesome staff. We usually take our friends and family to try it out. This place is awesome.

I went to the Roosevelt Room to meet a business colleague for a drink/happy hour.  So after I braved 5 o'clock traffic (yes it took me 30 minutes to go 1 mile!) I arrived for my first visit at the Roosevelt Room.I opened the heavy door to a dark area a small creature (I'm guessing some sort of host) who just looked at me.  I explained I was there to meet someone (I knew my colleague was already there so I walked past them and the heavy curtain) and the small creature said "do you know they are HERE?" I wasn't sure if they were implying like "here" as in place, space, or time, but I just said "yes" and moved on.  I had a feeling I was not the preferred demographic of the Roosevelt Room.I found my friend (who was from San Antonio) and apologized for being late because a 10 minute drive was 30 minutes and Austin is horrible.  She apologized because she said that she  realized that the Roosevelt Room waitstaff was very important and probably wouldn't be very attentive.  I told her that I was used to that because this is Austin and when you go out in Austin it is really like you are working for the waitstaff not like they are serving you.  I think it is part of the "experience".The Roosevelt Room is very dark and has an atmosphere going on.  It's great.  But if you are of the demographic that might need readers - you probably won't be able to see the menu.  So just ask the waiter (when they have time to show up) what drink they recommend and then they will help you out.  The drinks are really good and quite pretty.  And expensive.  Overall we had a good time at the Roosevelt Room.  Once our waiter realized we were spending a lot (expense account) he had more time for us.  Doubtful I will return.  We did eat some cheese board type food.  It was somewhat unremarkable.  We had to wait a while for everything (they kitchen was backed up... it was cheese!) They have giant ice cubes if you are into that.

On my honeymoon went in and ordered a $7 drink and was charged $11 for it. Didn't want to be that guy and argue over it. The people sitting in front of us (two couples) pointed at us and talk about us and laughed the whole time. The music is so loud it's almost impossible to order. I just had to point at what I wanted. I usually trust yelp reviews but not after this one.

Been ending our nights here most nights for the past few nights. The cocktails are on point with this one. I wouldn't recommend coming here for food. If you want finger food because you missed out with your friends or are feeling a snack but not for full on dinner. This is a good place to network and connect with business partners and colleagues as well as bring a hot date to at the same time. Every penny is well worth it. There was some lady who worked there who didn't match the place but all the staff were friendly and patient as colleagues talked their heads off. This will be my go to place for drinks and connecting in Austin. See you tonight and Salute!
What an experience!!! Hands down...the best intimate specialty coctail bar/lounge I've ever been. I wish there was one in Houston!
Great mixology and choice of classic drinks. Good for a business meeting without the food but they open at 4:00 pm

Would have given this place one star if our waitress Hirrah sucked, but she was hands down the best part of this "bar."Have you ever been to a BAR where you are asked to be quiet? I sure haven't until Joy, who is apparently the manager of the restaurant did. Mind you, the restaurant was loud and packed full of people and by no means were we being louder than our usual. We actually hit up 5 other bars the same night and never was once asked to be quiet. Joy actually humiliated our server and was extremely unprofessional. Joy came up to us while our server was at our table and asked us to be quiet. She then proceeded to discipline our server in front of us, making it uncomfortable for her and us. Joy basically was pissed because Hirrah our server didn't tell us to be quiet and she had to do it...one we weren't loud until she said something and continued to walk by our table and glare at us. She walked by 4 times within a 15 minute timeframe glaring. What kind of manager does that? If I were the owner I would re-evaluate who is managing the place cause you're gonna lose good people like Hirrah. Other than that, the food was delicious, drinks were also great. Being a visitor of Austin, I probably would not suggest coming here because of Joy. Her unprofessionalism was uncalled for.

Great speak-easy and bar menu. It's a unique signature place to have some incredible cocktails. They know how to make it right: from all era's of time, they mix their cocktails to suit your style.I couldn't find a bad thing about these drinks. The decor is beautiful, and the staff is absolute top notch. They consistently checked in with me. Gave me some vast knowledge of the restaurant/bar. There are more than 50 mixed cocktails, and over 20 unique signature concoctions that the owner came out with. So much more to write about this restaurant and the menu, but it's something you need to come and see for yourself. Come thirsty and hungry, because it's definitely worth the visit!

This place is awesome! I highly recommend the Roosevelt Room. It had a great vibe with really cool paintings on exposed brick. Sharon was so amazing. Every cocktail that she made looked amazing and tasted even better. She also had a great vibe about her and she was very enthusiastic and passionate about her craft.  You will love this place!

Had cocktails at The Roosevelt Room on Monday night. Wonderful environment to enjoy some well crafted and delicious drinks.Quality: The Roosevelt Room is the spot for cocktails in Austin. With a menu listing nearly 75 options, some house creations, others classic cocktails, there is something for everyone. And if you still can't find anything, the bartenders will put something together for you. Do not hesitate to take advantage of their knowledge, as they can provide guidance to get you exactly what you are looking for. On this evening I tried a Butterbean, a Black Mountain Coffee, and a Coconut Daiquiri. All three were solid drinks, expertly crafted, and beautifully presented.Quantity: Depends on the drink, some are just a few sips, others a solid pour.Value: The majority of cocktails ranged from $13 to $20.Ambiance: The Roosevelt Room is located in Downtown Austin. With a bit of separation from the rest of the Austin bar scene, The Roosevelt Room is a more elegant and stylish spot. As you push past the curtains you enter a dimly lit lounge. Black couches populate the right side and a long bar occupies the left. Black and white paintings decorate the walls, and a screen hung down showing episodes of Twin Peaks. Jazz and traditional pop filled the air, and we were informed live jazz takes over on Thursday. It is an intimate setting, one you almost feel like you should be dressed up to visit.Crowd: Even on a Monday night, nearly every seat in the house was full. Expect to see lots of couples on dates.Service: Bartenders that don't mess around when it comes to quality drinks.Parking: Limited street parking and nearby parking garages.

Went to the Roosevelt Room on Friday night around 6:30 for happy. We didn't have a reservation and didn't have to wait to sit at the long table/bar. The vibe/ inside decor is so so cool. There are pictures of Teddy and Eleanor on the walls and old books everywhere which is super fun. The menu is a little overwhelming at first but the waiters are super helpful and walk you through everything. We tried 1 alcoholic and 1 non-alcoholic and they were both amazing! Super nice spot the chill before going out or going to dinner.

Simply put - this place it awesome. Old-time speakeasy with a deep, expansive menu. If you can't find a drink here then maybe you're doing it wrong. The menus deep, varied, and delicious. There's something for everyone here. Within each drink category it starts mellow and gets progressively boozy. For me the Volstead (1933-1950's) was the sweet spot. The Millionaire was incredible! Went back for the Tiki (1950-1970's) Jungle Bird, you've never had anything like this. Modern Classics (2000s - present) Naked and Famous should be famous. And the Oaxaca Old Fashion is a mole twist on the tried and true old fashioned. Make plans, make a reservation and go. It's worth. Did I mention they play classic movies too! Yes please.

Best place to have any type of drink. Great service and awesome staff. We usually take our friends and family to try it out. This place is awesome.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

My friend and I came to Austin to celebrate the 4th of July and had an amazing experience at Edge with the BEST cabana service from Chelsea! She went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing day. She is super bubbly and brings the best energy! We couldn't have asked for anyone better to spend our day with. We'll be back for sure!
Juliana is an amazing cocktail server! What a great day at the JW! Her service was spot on..be sure & ask for her!! We'll be back!
SUCH A GREAT SERVICE!!!! So friendly, so helpful and so patient!!! Such a great place to hangout with friends for a birthday or bachelorette/bachelor party!!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty
Fun, relaxing happy hour with amazing cocktails to choose from including strawberry lemonade. Our tacos were delicious and the ahi tuna was amazing. Loved the view!

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Edge, I arrived with a few friends and was quickly greeted and sat by a really nice server named Julianna.  Her friendliness and quick service made our experience particularly enjoyable.  Beyond the great service, the food and drinks are on point.  Can't wait to go back!
Amazing view and amazing pool area! Really nice seating options and yummy prickly pearmargarita! Best rooftop  birthday photo shoot everrrr haha
The Poolside Cabana MADE our staycation.  Thank you Juliana for your impeccable service and attention to every detail.  It was because of you we had such and amazing experience.  We will be back.

This is probably the best pool scene you'll find in Austin. The bar service is so knowledgeable but also quick, even when you order from your lounge chair. The food comes out extremely quickly even when they are busy, so i commend them on that. I recommend the adobe chicken tacos 100% over!

Had a great time with my bachelor party this weekend courtesy of Diandra. We rented a cabana with a bachelorette party and had an absolute blast. We even ended up getting some relay races in the pool.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

My friend and I came to Austin to celebrate the 4th of July and had an amazing experience at Edge with the BEST cabana service from Chelsea! She went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing day. She is super bubbly and brings the best energy! We couldn't have asked for anyone better to spend our day with. We'll be back for sure!
Juliana is an amazing cocktail server! What a great day at the JW! Her service was spot on..be sure & ask for her!! We'll be back!
SUCH A GREAT SERVICE!!!! So friendly, so helpful and so patient!!! Such a great place to hangout with friends for a birthday or bachelorette/bachelor party!!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty
Fun, relaxing happy hour with amazing cocktails to choose from including strawberry lemonade. Our tacos were delicious and the ahi tuna was amazing. Loved the view!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty
Fun, relaxing happy hour with amazing cocktails to choose from including strawberry lemonade. Our tacos were delicious and the ahi tuna was amazing. Loved the view!

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Edge, I arrived with a few friends and was quickly greeted and sat by a really nice server named Julianna.  Her friendliness and quick service made our experience particularly enjoyable.  Beyond the great service, the food and drinks are on point.  Can't wait to go back!
Amazing view and amazing pool area! Really nice seating options and yummy prickly pearmargarita! Best rooftop  birthday photo shoot everrrr haha
The Poolside Cabana MADE our staycation.  Thank you Juliana for your impeccable service and attention to every detail.  It was because of you we had such and amazing experience.  We will be back.

This is probably the best pool scene you'll find in Austin. The bar service is so knowledgeable but also quick, even when you order from your lounge chair. The food comes out extremely quickly even when they are busy, so i commend them on that. I recommend the adobe chicken tacos 100% over!

Had a great time with my bachelor party this weekend courtesy of Diandra. We rented a cabana with a bachelorette party and had an absolute blast. We even ended up getting some relay races in the pool.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

My friend and I came to Austin to celebrate the 4th of July and had an amazing experience at Edge with the BEST cabana service from Chelsea! She went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing day. She is super bubbly and brings the best energy! We couldn't have asked for anyone better to spend our day with. We'll be back for sure!

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Edge, I arrived with a few friends and was quickly greeted and sat by a really nice server named Julianna.  Her friendliness and quick service made our experience particularly enjoyable.  Beyond the great service, the food and drinks are on point.  Can't wait to go back!
Amazing view and amazing pool area! Really nice seating options and yummy prickly pearmargarita! Best rooftop  birthday photo shoot everrrr haha
The Poolside Cabana MADE our staycation.  Thank you Juliana for your impeccable service and attention to every detail.  It was because of you we had such and amazing experience.  We will be back.

This is probably the best pool scene you'll find in Austin. The bar service is so knowledgeable but also quick, even when you order from your lounge chair. The food comes out extremely quickly even when they are busy, so i commend them on that. I recommend the adobe chicken tacos 100% over!

Had a great time with my bachelor party this weekend courtesy of Diandra. We rented a cabana with a bachelorette party and had an absolute blast. We even ended up getting some relay races in the pool.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

My friend and I came to Austin to celebrate the 4th of July and had an amazing experience at Edge with the BEST cabana service from Chelsea! She went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing day. She is super bubbly and brings the best energy! We couldn't have asked for anyone better to spend our day with. We'll be back for sure!
Juliana is an amazing cocktail server! What a great day at the JW! Her service was spot on..be sure & ask for her!! We'll be back!
SUCH A GREAT SERVICE!!!! So friendly, so helpful and so patient!!! Such a great place to hangout with friends for a birthday or bachelorette/bachelor party!!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty

SUCH A GREAT SERVICE!!!! So friendly, so helpful and so patient!!! Such a great place to hangout with friends for a birthday or bachelorette/bachelor party!!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty
Fun, relaxing happy hour with amazing cocktails to choose from including strawberry lemonade. Our tacos were delicious and the ahi tuna was amazing. Loved the view!

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Edge, I arrived with a few friends and was quickly greeted and sat by a really nice server named Julianna.  Her friendliness and quick service made our experience particularly enjoyable.  Beyond the great service, the food and drinks are on point.  Can't wait to go back!
Amazing view and amazing pool area! Really nice seating options and yummy prickly pearmargarita! Best rooftop  birthday photo shoot everrrr haha
The Poolside Cabana MADE our staycation.  Thank you Juliana for your impeccable service and attention to every detail.  It was because of you we had such and amazing experience.  We will be back.

This is probably the best pool scene you'll find in Austin. The bar service is so knowledgeable but also quick, even when you order from your lounge chair. The food comes out extremely quickly even when they are busy, so i commend them on that. I recommend the adobe chicken tacos 100% over!

Had a great time with my bachelor party this weekend courtesy of Diandra. We rented a cabana with a bachelorette party and had an absolute blast. We even ended up getting some relay races in the pool.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at Edge, I arrived with a few friends and was quickly greeted and sat by a really nice server named Julianna.  Her friendliness and quick service made our experience particularly enjoyable.  Beyond the great service, the food and drinks are on point.  Can't wait to go back!
Amazing view and amazing pool area! Really nice seating options and yummy prickly pearmargarita! Best rooftop  birthday photo shoot everrrr haha
The Poolside Cabana MADE our staycation.  Thank you Juliana for your impeccable service and attention to every detail.  It was because of you we had such and amazing experience.  We will be back.

This is probably the best pool scene you'll find in Austin. The bar service is so knowledgeable but also quick, even when you order from your lounge chair. The food comes out extremely quickly even when they are busy, so i commend them on that. I recommend the adobe chicken tacos 100% over!

Had a great time with my bachelor party this weekend courtesy of Diandra. We rented a cabana with a bachelorette party and had an absolute blast. We even ended up getting some relay races in the pool.

This place is awesome! I recommend going at night, the pool and lights looks so cool and they have a great DJ. Drinks are expensive but the vibe is well worth it. They even have corn hole and jenga. The views are rad too. Right in the middle of the city.

Came for a boys weekend, rented a cabana; it was amazing. Nice couches but the service was why we stayed and will come back! Chelsea Kelly made the whole experience. Phenomenal service, couldn't have been better.

As far as rooftop pools go, this one is on a lower  floor than most but it does not disappoint. Drinks and drink specials are great and the food is phenom. I LOVE the chicken adobo tacos. I like that they have frosé especially in the Texas heat. Employees are super friendly and the JW never disappoints.

There is mediocre customer service and then you have Julianna that is the epitome of family service. Julianna treats you like you are a guest in her house and with the utmost attention to detail. She has a telepathic skill in anticipating your every need. The Edge Rooftop and Bar needs to use Julianna as the platinum standard in hospitality services.

JW Marriott is hands down best hotel in town - and this bar is amazing. We come down for a few summer weekend getaway trips a year from Dallas and can't get enough of this place. The pool service is outstanding - specifically the lovely Julianna who always remembers us and makes sure we are well taken care of for our entire stay. Be sure to sit in her section if you can - you won't regret it! Unforgettable experience every time

Rooftop pool and bar at the JW is one of my favorite places in Austin. Amazing views, music and vibe. Also, the service is outstanding!For MDW and 4th of July my buddies and I rented a cabana for the pool party. Julianna made sure the food and beverages were flowing. She's the best.

The edge rooftop pool is the highlight of our annual visit to Austin, and Julianna always goes above and beyond to make us feel at home. We always try to sit in her section of the pool just to enjoy her company! Love her and love this pool
Great view of the city and capitol building. Breezy pool is open. Nice for couples and groups of friends.

My friend and I came to Austin to celebrate the 4th of July and had an amazing experience at Edge with the BEST cabana service from Chelsea! She went above and beyond to ensure we had an amazing day. She is super bubbly and brings the best energy! We couldn't have asked for anyone better to spend our day with. We'll be back for sure!
Juliana is an amazing cocktail server! What a great day at the JW! Her service was spot on..be sure & ask for her!! We'll be back!
SUCH A GREAT SERVICE!!!! So friendly, so helpful and so patient!!! Such a great place to hangout with friends for a birthday or bachelorette/bachelor party!!

Chelsea Kelly is the friendliest most attentive and knowledgeable servicer I have ever met.  She took care of our 8 person group and knew everyone by name before the day was over she was like one of the family.  Could not ask for better.  Kelly has a five star personality and provides five star service.  Marriot is lucky to have her.

We were in Austin from Dallas for a Girls Weekend. I reserved a cabana for Saturday. The Edge people were excellent at staying in contact before Saturday as the weather was very questionable. They called the day before to see if we would prefer a cabana on Sunday due to the questionable weather. We decided to stick with Saturday with fingers crossed. Luckily Mother Nature was in a favour!About the cabanas: They are so gorgeous, classy, and comfy. They were just as nice and even nicer than some cabanas in Vegas. Equipped with high end, oversize patio furniture, flat screen tv, speaker system, tables, and curtains (for privacy if needed). They tap in upbeat lounge music in the cabanas but they will provide an auxiliary cord for you to hook your phone up to listen to your own tunes. About the service: Our server was Julianna. And OH. IM. GEE, she was amazing! I owned a hotel poolside bar in Waikiki for four years. As a business owner, I was EXTREMELY picky about my employees. Based on her attitude, her service, her personality, I would have LOVED to have Julianna as an employee as I KNOW she would have been a great asset to my bar and business. Julianna was so very patient with us 13 girls who every time she turned around, we were asking for something or for her to take a photo of us. And of course, she so obligingly did and she even posed us and took the photo shots from different angles. So not only is she a great server but a fabulous photographer as well! Being a previous bar owner, I know an employee can make or break a business. Julianna MADE The Edge! If and when we return, we will be requesting her! My hairdresser and her husband are staying at the hotel this Memorial weekend. I already texted her to request Julianna as her server! :)About the food and drinks: We ordered food but I chose the "liquid lunch" so I'm not sure how the food was but visually, it look very appetizing and plentiful. We ordered bottle service so can't really tell you how well the drinks were. However, drunk me decided to buy 25 shots (24 lemon drops and 1 Patron shot). The bartendar and Julianna handled the big order very well and timely btw.Views: Incredible!I HIGHLY HIGHLY recommend The Edge for your poolside destination! I will admit, it was between them or The W Hotel's pool. The W is "Guest ONLY" on Saturdays meaning EVERY person at the pool must be a hotel guest. JW Marriott did not have this rule so THEY made the money off of 13 people with only two of us being hotel guests. And based on the photos of The W's pool, deck, and cabanas.....JW Marriott's The Edge BLOWS them away! One last note/tip: Try to get a room with a pool view if you stay here. The pool has the shape of Texas in the middle which makes a great photo opp! *See attached*
Juliana was awesome in our cabana!! Excellent service, friendly, and helpfulFood was greatClean area that was really pretty
